column1: // WARNING: ensure this file is saved in text CSV format when modifying this file

column4: DESCRIPTION
The name of the process that generated the frame.
The process ID of the process that generated the frame.
The address of the swap chain used to present the frame.
The API used to present the frame.
The sync interval provided by the application when presenting the frame. Note: this value may be modified later by the driver, e.g., based on control panel overrides.
The present flags provided by the application when presenting the frame.
1 if partial frames might be displayed on the screen, or 0 if only full frames are displayed.
The presentation mode used by the system for this frame.  See the table below for more details.
Whether the frame was rendered by the application or generated by a driver/SDK.
The time the CPU started working on this frame.
The time the CPU started working on this frame, as a QueryPerformanceCounter() value.
How long it took from the start of this frame until the CPU started working on the next frame.
How long the CPU spent working on this frame before presenting it.
How long the CPU spent waiting before starting the next frame.
How long it took from the start of this frame until the GPU started working on it.
The total amount of time that GPU was working on this frame.
How long the GPU was actively working on this frame (i.e., the time during which at least one GPU engine is executing work from the target process).
How long the GPU was idle while working on this frame.
How long the GPU video encode/decode engines were actively working on this frame.
How long it took from the start of this frame until the frame was displayed on the screen.
How long the frame was displayed on the screen, or 'NA' if the frame was not displayed.
The difference between the previous frame's CPU delta and display delta.
The time the CPU started animation work on this frame.
How long it took from the earliest mouse click that contributed to this frame until this frame was displayed.
How long it took from the earliest keyboard or mouse interaction that contributed to this frame until this frame was displayed.
The rate at which new frames are being displayed on the screen.
The rate at which the application is rendering and displaying new frames to the screen.
The rate at which the application is calling Present().
Indicates if the frame was not displayed.
Vendor name of the GPU.
Device name of the GPU.
Vendor name of the CPU.
Device name of the CPU.
Sustained power limit of the GPU.
Power consumed by the graphics adapter.
Voltage consumed by the graphics adapter.
Clock speed of the GPU cores.
Temperature of the GPU.
Rate at which a GPU cooler fan is rotating.
Amount of GPU processing capacity being used.
Amount of 3D/Compute processing capacity being used.
Amount of media processing capacity being used.
GPU frequency is being limited because GPU is exceeding maximum power limits.
GPU frequency is being limited because GPU is exceeding maximum temperature limits.
GPU frequency is being limited because GPU is exceeding maximum current limits.
GPU frequency is being limited because GPU is exceeding maximum voltage limits.
GPU frequency is being limited due to low GPU utilization.
Power consumed by the GPU memory.
Voltage consumed by the GPU memory.
Clock speed of the GPU memory.
Effective data transfer rate GPU memory can sustain.
Temperature of the GPU memory.
Size of the GPU memory.
Amount of used GPU memory.
Percent of GPU memory used.
Maximum total GPU memory bandwidth.
Maximum GPU memory bandwidth for writing.
Maximum GPU memory bandwidth for reading.
Memory frequency is being limited because the memory modules are exceeding the maximum power limits.
Memory frequency is being limited because the memory modules are exceeding the maximum temperature limits.
Memory frequency is being limited because the memory modules are exceeding the maximum current limits.
Memory frequency is being limited because the memory modules are exceeding the maximum voltage limits.
Memory frequency is being limited due to low memory traffic.
Amount of CPU processing capacity being used.
Power limit of the CPU.
Power consumed by the CPU.
Temperature of the CPU.
Clock speed of the CPU.
Amount of CPU processing utility being used per core.
Instrumented Frame Start To Display Latency
column5: How long it took from the instrumented start of this frame until the frame was displayed on the screen.
